news.title: Essential Unix-based Anaconda Setup Guide
news.subTitle: 8 FEBRUARY 2020
news.text: This article describes the essential steps required for installing Anaconda and creating a conda environment on a Unix-based OS.

news.title: DeepLearning.AI Tensorflow Developer Coursera Certification
news.subTitle: 13 APRIL 2020
news.text:
Completed all 4 courses of the DeepLearning.AI Tensorflow Developer Professional Certificate program:

  • Introduction to TensorFlow for Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning
  • Convolutional Neural Networks in TensorFlow
  • Natural Language Processing in TensorFlow
  • Sequences, Time Series and Prediction

news.title: Website Live
news.subTitle: 31 JULY 2020
news.text:
cadebe.dev went live today!

What started off as an experiment on how to upload content to AWS S3 and integrating an SSL certificate with AWS CloudFront, gradually morphed into a website.

news.title: Creating a ReactJS Static Website with AWS S3 and CloudFront
news.subTitle: 2 SEPTEMBER 2020
news.text: There are numerous online articles that describe how to configure AWS S3 in order to host a static website. In fact S3 makes this quite easy. However, many of these articles do not necessarily follow best practices, especially in terms of security requirements. And there are also a number of gotchas along the way to keep an eye on. I built a simple React JS website and deployed it onto AWS. This is how I did it.

news.title: AWS Certified Developer – Associate (DVA-C01)
news.subTitle: 23 SEPTEMBER 2020
news.text: I passed the AWS Developer Associate Examination today.

news.title: AOP and the Spring Framework
news.subTitle: 11 OCTOBER 2020
news.text: Aspect Oriented Programming (AOP) has been around for a while but has always felt inaccessible, partly due to the opaque-sounding terminology. Actually, it is quite simple and a really powerful tool. I built a demo example using the Spring Framework, and illustrated the terminology with practical explanations. Doing is understanding!

news.title: TensorFlow Serving for Deployment
news.subTitle: 27 FEBRUARY 2021
news.text: TensorFlow Serving is a flexible, high-performance serving system for machine learning models, designed for production environments. It provides out-of-the-box integration with TensorFlow models by providing an easily accessible API to directly query a pre-trained model. Whilst here are several methods by which TensorFlow Serving can be installed, this example uses Docker.

news.title: Oracle Certified Professional: Java SE 11 Developer (1Z0-819)
news.subTitle: 6 FEBRUARY 2023
news.text: I passed the OCP Java SE 11 Developer examination. This has been a tough exam and has consumed a large amount of my free time over of the course of the past year, at the expense of many other development activities. It has been worthwhile, though. My Java skills have been supercharged.

news.title: Oracle Certified Professional: Java SE 17 Developer (1Z0-829)
news.subTitle: 31 MARCH 2023
news.text: I leveraged on my recent studies for the OCP Java SE 11 Developer exam to pass the OCP Java SE 17 Developer examination. As Oracle puts it: "By passing the required exam, a certified individual proves tremendous fluency in Java SE and the acquisition of the valuable professional skills required to be a Java software developer."

news.title: Support Vector Machines with skearn
news.subTitle: 1 JULY 2023
news.text:
Support Vector Machines (SVMs) are supervised machine learning algorithms used for classification problems. Data is mapped to a high-dimensional feature space so that data points can be categorised based in two dimensions. The algorithm creates an optimal hyperplane that divides the dataset into two classes, and then uses support vectors as its building block for classifying new data observations. Support vectors are the data points nearest to the hyperplane, meaning their influence is greater compared to other observations further away from the model boundary.

sklearn provides a simple Python-based API to unlock the power of SVMs. This project demonstrates how a SVM can be used for binary classification, based on a Kaggle dataset.

news.title: HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate (003)
news.subTitle: 27 SEPTEMBER 2023
news.text: I passed the HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate exam today. </br></br>Terraform provides an Infrastructure and Code (IaC) solution that simplifies the process of automating and standardising Cloud infrastructure. It allows users to define and provision infrastructure resources in a declarative configuration language. With Terraform, you can manage various cloud services and providers, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and many others, as well as on-premises infrastructure components.

news.title: AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate (SAA-C03)
news.subTitle: 6 DECEMBER 2023
news.text: I passed the AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate exam today.</br></br>The preparation for this exam equipped me with a deeper understanding of the event-driven nature of cloud architectures. It has also taught me how to strategically design well-architected distributed systems that are scalable, resilient, efficient, and fault-tolerant.

news.title: VMware Spring Certified Professional 2024 (2V0-72.22)
news.subTitle: 8 JANUARY 2024
news.text: I passed the VMware Spring Certified Professional 2024 exam today.</br></br>The objective to deepen my understanding of the Spring Framework has evolved into a successfully completed certification journey. learned tonnes of useful bits and believe that it makes me a more effective and confident Spring-based developer. I highly recommend this certification for the valuable skillset and knowledge that comes with its preparation.</br></br>Spring IoC • Spring AOP • Spring Data • Spring Boot • Spring MVC • Spring Security •Spring Rest • Spring Testing.</br></br>All things Spring Core.

news.title: AWS Certified Developer – Associate (DVA-C02)
news.subTitle: 15 FEBRUARY 2024
news.text: I renewed my AWS Certified Developer – Associate certification today. This means that, together with the recently accomplished AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate certification, I now hold two valid AWS credentials simultaneously. More than that though, I have learned tonnes along the way and feel comfortable working in the AWS Cloud.

news.title: Google Cloud Certified - Associate Cloud Engineer
news.subTitle: 26 APRIL 2024
news.text: I passed the Google Cloud Certified - Associate Cloud Engineer exam today. I aimed to boost my skills in Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), so it made sense to get a strong foundation in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) as a whole. This certification now allows me to leverage GCP for various projects, including machine learning tasks.
